website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic hybrid smartwatch for monitoring one’s health, as the sporty Vívomove HR tracks stress levels, calories burned, distance traveled, and more.
pros: Incoming call, text message, calendar reminders, and other notifications
5-day battery life in smart mode or 2 weeks in watch mode
cons: Although this hybrid smartwatch is rechargeable, some Garmin smartwatch batteries can last up to a year

website_summaries.verdict: Garmin's heart-tracking blend of fashion watch and fitness watch is a great choice for everyday watch wearers who want a fully embedded fitness experience.
pros: Full fitness features on a regular-looking analog watch
The Vivomove HR includes heart rate, step count and sleep tracking, and smart functions like notifications
It works on Android and iOS and has 50-meter water resistance and a weeklong-plus battery life
cons: The tiny touch display is hard to navigate
It lasts longer in watch-only mode but won't track fitness, and the glass body can collect scuffs

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Spent a while looking (even bought a couple cheapies) to replace my Fitbit. Nothing was as advertised and it was discouraging. Took a chance on this one and I'm very happy with it. Took me next to no effort to sync to my phone and adjust the setting. The battery lasts for DAYS (no joke) and it does way more than my Fitbit including monitoring 24/7 heartrate. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Attractive BUT...
customer_reviews.text: The watch is really attractive and fits good on the arm. There is a little difficult understanding the fitness icons on the watch and some difficulty selecting the actual fitness icon that relates to your activity. The only thing that really really bothers me is...the watch scars my arm leaving dark spots and then my skin peels. I wear it loose and it still scars my arm. I'm thinking its the light that flashes on the backside. I'm likely going to get another watch.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: it worked good for the first 2
customer_reviews.text: it worked good for the first 2.5 months, now its giving wrong information telling me that I'm stressed when I'm sleeping and that I'm only sleeping 1 hr and 45 minuets per night (it used to tell me the correct amount) , telling me that my heart rate is lower it is (checked with a heart rate monitor. The return window is 2 months so I guess use it for a $200 watch.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: I(dont) love Hybrid watches(update)
customer_reviews.text: I had another, from a lesser known company and it lasted for about 5 months. I shopped around a bit but kept coming back to this one. I am definitely impressed by it. The set up was super easy. And it's easy to use. Recommend highly! This watch wasnt as great as I thought it was. Completely waste of money, glitches out. The face time is off by 16 minutes and no matter what I try it doesn't help it. It also glitches out for no reason. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch to track activities without looking like a sports watch. Setup was easy although the time was off by one hour. It was an easy fix online - just needed to calibrate the hands. This is probably my fault since I didn’t really follow instructions with the watch, just the connected to phone. Only problem is the light background makes reading the digital output difficult in bright sunlight. If I’m checking the time, it is not an issue
customer_reviews.author: bet22

customer_reviews.title: Works precisely as advertised
customer_reviews.text: If you want (nearly all) of the functionality of higher-end Garmins (like the Fenix series), but hide it all inside a traditional looking (GREAT looking) watch... then this is for you. The only thing it does not have is built-in GPS.)
customer_reviews.author: Sandan KenpoTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Always Accurately Track Heart Rate :(
customer_reviews.text: I love the aesthetics and the features of this watch. I chose it because I believed that Garmin has the best products and I loved this watch because it doesn't look like a giant clunky fitness watch, I can wear it for almost any occasion (work, casual outings, formal outings, the gym, etc.). However, I have noticed that it does not consistently capture my heart rate which is extremely disappointing because that was my sole purpose for purchasing this. After spending $200 I am not happy that I will probably have to either buy a new watch entirely or buy a compatible heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Surya Martin

customer_reviews.title: Cute activity tracker, didnt last a year
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn it a week, but its stylish, easy to use, and accurately tracks my activity, heart rate, steps, etc. **** Update: About a month short of its one year anniversary, this watch stopped syncing. It no longer tracks my heart rate, steps, activity and I can no longer get messages or calls, or cannot control my music. It is now a garmin watch, with a laytex band that leaves me with a rash! If you are going to take a chance on it, i don't recommend the latex wrist.band. it looks nice, but chafes and leave a nasty rash.
customer_reviews.author: t l

customer_reviews.title: i love this watch!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this has been the best watch ive used; I have a garmin 230 and I don't really use it anymore. this one is amazing. its a great tracker AND is classy looking. no one knows its a smart watch unless they see the numbers light up. I get tons of compliments and then everyone is amazed that its also smart. great watch! and great customer service when had trouble with it. looked like their was water under the face and it stopped connecting to my phone and charging. garmin replaced it immediately with no trouble!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Moffit

customer_reviews.title: Works well, looks good
customer_reviews.text: This was a big upgrade from my previous (4 year old) fitness tracker. I get compliments on it's appearance regularly. I love that it tracks heart rate and gives me my average resting heart rate.I do have to take it off for some of my exercises (aerial arts), but I would have to do this with any brand/model of fitness tracker watch. Also, the connect app is lacking in exercise variety to manually enter (any type of dance). But these are things that I can live with.
customer_reviews.author: Elly

customer_reviews.title: Fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: This works great for what I was looking for and my needs. Great looking semi-smart watch that looks like a watch. I only need the steps, heart rate, sleep, and water proof. It met all of those and works great for those. The only downside is it feels a bit cheap on the face which I scratched working in the yard on day 2. I recommend the face protector which I had on order but not installed. I gave it 4 stars as it fits my needs but I feel it is lacking a bit for the $200 price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Simple but Annoyed
customer_reviews.text: At first, I loved the way this looks. It is simple and does what I need it to. The look and ability are exactly what I was hoping for. The ability to use the touch screen is nearly impossible. It is hard to touch and tap the screen. The worst part is that this watch ONLY works with IPHONE! Literally. I bought this watch as I moved back to Android and was highly disappointed to learn that the apps for Garmin are only on iphone. Don't say I didn't warn you.
customer_reviews.author: TIFFANI

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a sleek looking watch that has all of the smart watch capabilities and that’s exactly what I got
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research, Garmin Vivomove HR was my choice. I wanted a sleek looking watch that has all of the smart watch capabilities and that’s exactly what I got. The watch’s battery is excellent and lasts 5+days even with many notifications a day. It is truly a hidden gem and much better looking than the square, ugly Apple Watch. I recommend this watch to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Holland

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch
customer_reviews.text: Stays paired to my phone without issues and Always lets me know when I have a notification whether it's a call or txt, or other app, and lets me know Who is calling or txt, and can read the txt (no respond). The app works well, steps, stairs, HR are reasonably accurate. Love the find my phone feature which works even when my phone is in silent mode, which it is all of the time. I thought it was going to look too big or too sporty, but it looks great and is easy to dress up or down as well. I have thin wrists and it doesn't overwhelm them, No issues, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Overall I love this smartwatch and would buy again
customer_reviews.text: It is just over a year and my Garmin smartwatch is still going strong. GPS works great, overall step counter is accurate. Battery life is great. My only issues are sleep tracking not being the most accurate. And also measuring my heart bpm is sometimes troublesome. My heart rate when walking is normally in the 90 bpm range. When it tells me it is 60 bpm then I know it's not tracking properly. This seems to be resolved with placement on my wrist and I have to fiddle with it a bit to finally get it place right. But overall it has been a very good smartwatch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Upgrade, wish screen display was better
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded since my Fitbit had a big crack in the screen. I'm not sure if it's just mine but, I feel like the screen display is not very crisp. My screen always seems to look dirty or hazy. I have a screen protector on but it seemed this way right out of the box. I was able to wear the small/medium Fitbit bands but the small one for the Garmin is much smaller and I will eventually need to get a larger band. Still a very nice watch and I like it so far and have no plans to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Fits amazing she was a bit worried at first cause most watches are uncomfortable to her but this actually have several fitment holes that allows for great adjustability. Tracking for pedometer is very handy and the message reading display works well also. Only issue is the battery life isn't as long as it states but my wife's job does require a lot of motions with her hands so it was probably constant on and off due to wrist motions. I highly recommend this and color is very good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Chambers

customer_reviews.title: NOT value for money!!!
customer_reviews.text: A very good watch indeed, I must admit, however, I am totally disappointed after only having purchased the watch in February and noticing the LED display fade away into nothingness after a paltry 2 months. To add insult to injury, the return window closed about a month before this failure, and to rub salt in the wound, after reaching out to customer support, no response to date. VERY, VERY DISAPPOINTING!!! Had I known that the LED display would have failed in this hybrid watch and that there would be no support afterwards, I would have spent my money somewhere else on something else...seriously!
customer_reviews.author: Kes

customer_reviews.title: I think it's boring and not as refined as expected
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this item; it looked stylish and gave me fitness information thati was looking for. However, I found the item to just be "blah" when i got it hooked up. It bugs me that the watch hands move on their own even if they aren't interfering with the screen; the digital text wasn't as crisp as it appeared in the photos; the vibrations weren't very strong and didn't last long. I also found that it took me quite a bit if time to set it up. I liked that face of the watch but that's about it. It's going back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: ohhkayyy

customer_reviews.title: Poor design- do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The good - great battery life- much better than the apple watch. Now the bad- I can't get my phone to connect the messages and phone calls to the watch so I am notified. I've tried everything. Not intuituve at all. Be warned- do not buy this product. The wrist strap falls off constantly. The small pegs that fit into the indents on either side of the strap - which are supposed to keep the strap attached to the watch face - aren't secure. Clearly a poor design. I wouldn't buy this watch again. I regret buying it at all. Not worth $200
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and exactly as advertised. Does everything that you expect, steps, calories, stairs, watch, stopwatch...etc. No issue with tracking steps or collecting data. Website is user friendly enough. Kind of hard to see in bright sunlight, but fine if you shade it with you hand. I had an allergic reaction to the band, so I bought a leather band and that fixed that. The bands were easy to replace and took about 2 minutes from opening the box to putting it on my wrist. Looks like a watch so no one knows I am tracking my steps.
customer_reviews.author: Crissie Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: This Watch is WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: It looks smart and stylish. I have worn a VIVO for years and tried to try another brand. The new brand wouldn't work with my health plan. So I returned it and ordered this VIVO. I was able to use my same app, just to add the new watch. This watch is keeps detailed track of my sleep, exercise, steps, heart rate, blood pressure and more. I can see the time at night. I purchased an additional band, which satisfies the watch collector in me. I would definitely recommend this watch. My only downside is the "charging". My old VIVO used batteries and did not need to be recharged.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'd expect better from garmin
customer_reviews.text: I have had the watch for 3 months now and as much as I wanted to love the watch it overall continues to disappoint. You would expect for it to perform effortlessly but unfortunately it doesn't. It constantly disconnects from my phone and impairs. I have a galaxy note 10 so I'm not dealing with an old phone problem. Also the charge doesn't hold for more than 2 days and that's after stopping almost every app notification. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Griselda Rivera

customer_reviews.title: The perfect meld of a classic time piece with modern features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a nicer looking option than my fénix sapphire 3 (which I love). In comparison to that watch this is smaller, lighter, sleeker, but also feels a bit cheap in comparison. However, this watch was more than I’d expected. It’s beautiful. It functions very well as a step tracker and the widgets are easy to use and access. I love the analog face with all the perks of a smart watch if you want it. The battery life exceeded my expectations as well. Almost a whole week without needing a charge. Absolutely love it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Denali Brothers

customer_reviews.title: Wrong time
customer_reviews.text: The hands of the clock are not accurate. I bought this watch less than two months ago. The digital time is correct but the analog time is not. It has been slowly losing time over the past month but now it is close to 10 minutes off. I like everything else about the watch. I am going back to my Garmin 235 which I have had for years and still works great.
customer_reviews.author: indymomma

customer_reviews.title: Only good for time!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is beautiful! BUT I don’t recommend it! If often doesn’t respond when you need it. Just to wake it up you have to tap it at least five times. In order to do anything you have to go through a series of taps and swipes and most the time I give up. It’s impossible to get where I want. I’ve turned off the notifications! I can’t ever see the name of the person calling or texting. It’s only good for time and the fitness tracking you keep on the home screen. Don’t try to look at it during the day or in sunlight. You won’t see a thing!
customer_reviews.author: carmin

customer_reviews.title: Darn band chaffing is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this watch and fitness tracker. For the first month, it was amazing this i could just leave it on for a week and shower with it. The proble First off, i think the fitbit app and info is far superior. the garmin does provide vo max, something i have always been curious about. The problem. It is a biggie. After the first month or so, the bamd started chaffing my wrist. Really badly. I stopped showering with it on in hopes of getting better. no luck. I remember that fitbit had a similar problem that i did not experience. ow is all i can say. Cant wear the watch/tracker. Dont buy!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Features are great
customer_reviews.text: Received it at time of Garmin being hacked. Had to wait a week after I purchased it to download and connect to the app. Had a problem with connecting at first, but finally succeeded. I am very happy with the Garmin Vivomove HR Watch. It records so much more than the Fitbit. I really like all the info on sleep and heart rate. Very detailed. I would recommend this watch to anyone wanting to stay fit.
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: No good for working out
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this watch, I really did. It looks beautiful and is comfortable to wear for everyday wear. Seems fine for tracking steps. I wanted it for heart rate monitoring and it lets me down in a big way. It seems fine for simple activities like running and walking, but any other workouts (I like CrossFit type workouts)- it’s very poor. And it actually seems to be getting worse. I wouldn’t recommend the watch, I actually wish I hadn’t purchased. I purchased in August, and really wanted to like this watch.. but I am not pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a pretty smart watch!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always wanted a smart watch but wanted it to look like a regular watch, lol. This is the watch I’ve been looking for! It looks great when I go out with my friends and family. It also looks great for the gym! I love how it super looks regular and people are surprised when I tell them it’s a smart watch. Anyway, I just needed the basic things as well like a sleep tracker, steps, HR, and a few more basics.. so this watch satisfies those needs.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBug

customer_reviews.title: Style and function
customer_reviews.text: Love the stylish look keeps great time battery life is great I can go a week before I charge and charging is fast. I sent one back not a Garmin that I had to charge in 3 days and no warning this one give me a warning so I'm not wearing a dead watch when I forget. I love the way the hands move out of the way when checking the features awesome and the online app is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this hybrid watch. I get so many compliments on it, and when I mention that it's also a smart watch, people are surprised and excited. It's very comfortable and classy and can go with anything. The garmin connect app is not great, but the watch itself is.
customer_reviews.author: kait

customer_reviews.title: Very large face
customer_reviews.text: Will not comment on functionality as I did not use it. I ordered the small size as my wrist is small for an adult. I thought the watch face would be decreased exponentially to match the smaller band size, but it is not. The watch face was as big as my entire wrist. Had to go back.
customer_reviews.author: sara o

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is great
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this watch. I am a runner and have used other brand of watches for running. I’ll never use anything besides garmin again. I picked this one based off price and looks along with stats it gives. It gives me what I’m looking for running stats and it syncs with my phone nicely. If you have had an apple but want better life this is a good one to switch too. Super happy and so pretty!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts about 5 days which is great! The app is fantastic. The watch is comfy and stylish. I had some stress when getting it setup since it came in Swedish. So hard to figure out how to change the language. The band gets discolored easily by clothing since it’s white. Overall I LOVE all the features and it works amazing with my iPhone Bluetooth. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: pblee513

customer_reviews.title: You're paying for the asthetic
customer_reviews.text: This watch is beautiful. I bought it because it was the only classic style smart watch I could find that would give me the smart watch features and look nice in an office setting or the gym. The watch itself doesn't seem to do anything more than similar smart watches in the $40-$50 price range so you're basically paying for the aesthetic and not the function. Still deciding weather or not I completely wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Balance between smart and style
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a balance, a fitness tracker that looked like a regular, classy watch - not like a fitness band or a smartwatch. The Garmin Vivomove HR fit the bill nicely. It tracks nearly everything my Vivosport does, just no GPS, which is fine - I won't be running with this. Looks great and is comfortable too. Battery life is very good. My only complaint is that it can be a little hard to activate the digital face - sometimes the wrist rotation doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great, a little quirky
customer_reviews.text: It had a few quirky interactions with iOS with certain permission enablement. This was solved with a couple web searches. We were also originally perplexed at how the watch-hands move when looking at the watch face-- it turns out that's a feature that is intended to ensure the hands never obscure the digital display portion. Otherwise, my fiancee, who was gifted this for Christmas, loves it. She wanted something with a good, detailed face to view notifications, was not as aggressive with fitness goals as Fitbit is, and also looks like an analog watch, so this did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Rubi III

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and motivational watch.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite function is the MOVE! message it gives me to remind me to get up and move around. I have been wearing the watch about 36 hours at least and the charge is still high. The only improvement needed is the touchscreen sometimes takes 2-3 tries but now that I’m getting use to it, that’s happening less and less. I would definitely recommend it to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila67

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds. Well executed
customer_reviews.text: This a fantastic hybrid watch. Best of both worlds. Functionally this is all I would want from a smart watch as I'd much rather a device that looks like a watch (which it does brilliantly). The sleep tracker and heart rate monitoring work well for me. An all around winner.
customer_reviews.author: rgd86

customer_reviews.title: Attractive watch and features
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Garmin Vivomove HR in White/Rose Gold as an everyday wearing accessory. It takes a little time to get use to the features. Installing the Garmin Connect app on your smart device is a must to manage all of the features available on the watch. Very stylish and can be worn either in gym attire or dressing up and going out.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I have had it for about a year now and can say that it has fufilled everthing I was wanting in a smart watch. This has a real watch face with the notifications show up at the bottom of the watch. The hands do move out of the way when you look at your notifications. I do want to see that a complaint that i heave seen is that the battery life is really short, mine lasts for about a week before i need to recharge. If you turn of the notifications you won't have a battery issue. Otherwise i have really enjoyed this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wigle

customer_reviews.title: Love this Watch. It is stylish for business life but great for any day everyday life.
customer_reviews.text: Only bad, the hands tend to move so when they reset to the hands may be off on time and will have to be reset. I wear this watch swimming, biking, walking, running, lifting. It is very versatile, very durable. I was concerned with the size in the beginning as it may be too big when lifting but I have had no issues. I love this watch and wish I could order another for my boyfriend but the cost is pretty high. Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary.p

customer_reviews.title: Poor security practices for the App
customer_reviews.text: The biggest disappointment is the application and the hack that occurred. A tech company should have world class practices in place to protect their digital assets-they didn’t. And had a ransom ware attack. It went from bad to worse. Little to know communication from them on the status of the fix or how to get the app working again a week or so after the attack. For these reasons, I would not recommend purchasing this smart watch. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to wear for everyday, because my Forerunner 35 does not look that great with some dressier outfits.; it has a great size and look. It is not as easy to use for tracking workouts, etc.; but it is doable...and I love it in conjunction with my Foreunner 35. They both work together great with the Garmin Connect app. <3
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive watch! Bought because of Garmin name.
customer_reviews.text: Looks gorgeous! Way nicer than a sport watch. Just got this week, so I haven't used all the features. Tracks steps. Will be using for outdoor running. Band seems nice so far even though some reviews said it was flimsy. I'll wait and see but I am being mindful since reading that review.
customer_reviews.author: AB Fit

customer_reviews.title: A classy smart watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch! It's classy looking but still has all the functions of a fitness tracker. I would highly recommend! *edited review, March 17, 2020* Still love the watch, but the glass face has broken along the edges. I have a screen protector but it doesn't seem to matter. Disappointed that I will probably have to replace the watch soon because the glass is broken.
customer_reviews.author: April May June

customer_reviews.title: No fuss, till washing hands
customer_reviews.text: I live the hybrid face. It's pretty and displays what I need wo the fuss of full face smartwatches. However, the silicone band caused raw marks on my wrist from sweating or washing my hands. Any other replacement bands' pins don't fit. I suggest the leather band for anyone not swimming with it.
customer_reviews.author: Phylicia McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 33 days of light use
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 33 days. It started off as an okay watch. I love that it was simple and only gave you what you needed. Battery life was great. But the hands on the watch are mechanical and failed 33 days after purchase. I'm a new mom and I haven't even worked out with it. The most I've done are stroller walks. One of the reasons I purchased this watch was for the Garmin name since I've had several watches but there's before and they all seemed robust. I'm very disappointed in this Garmin product... it just doesn't seem in line with their brand.
customer_reviews.author: Peter MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: No help to get started.
customer_reviews.text: I've now spent about 2 hours trying to connect the Vivomove HR to my smartphone. I tried every troubleshooting technique provided and videos but I cannot connect. There is no support available. I will have to return the device and go back to using the cheap knockoffs that have worked. I imagine that it would have been useful if I could have gotten it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, if you don't need a screen
customer_reviews.text: The screen is not very sharp, it's nearly unreadable. There clock hands wanted out of sync every few days, and over all it's just not that useful. The heart rate is good and step counting is to, but that's the limit of the data it collects reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Wow, works well and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Durable and stylish. I own a ranch and am a physician on the go. I have put this watch through a lot over the past three months and it has done great. The hr and steps monitoring is great. The other features I am still learning. Now the stairs reading is off, however Garmin team is aware and working on a fix. Really I am not that concerned with the stairs monitoring. The vo2 max seems to be on target. I just completed a lab based eval of vo2 max so I will see how the two compare once the results are available.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Casual yet classy HR smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: I love my new watch! This is the first smart watch I’ve had so I can’t compare it to others but it has been a great motivator in leading a healthier lifestyle. I feel the app is easy to navigate and I’m still learning something about my watches abilities each day. I like that it looks like a regular watch and is both casual enough to wear everyday and classy enough to not look like a phone strapped to my wrist for work and other occasions. I would highly recommend. I’ve charged the battery once for about 15 minutes in the span of two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Smith624

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great color, nice price, and delivered when expected. Gave as gift to spouse and she really loved the color. Only issue was, after using for two days, she broke out in a rash all along her wrist that was in contact with the band. Rash lasted a week and, after leaving it off another week, returned after wearing the band around 10 hours. Still playing around with potential cures so she can use it daily
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the tracker party, but I like this particular one. It is durable enough to withstand a good dog washing or gardening. It does not give me credit for stairs, but it is probably due to an error on my part. I don't like to fiddle with settings, so I truly just charged it and go! I like that it prompts me every 20 minutes to "move" when I'm working from the laptop. Easily syncs with the app on my smarphone.
customer_reviews.author: Laney

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Garmin vivomove in October of 2018, 5 months ago. It lost its ability to stay charged longer than a day around month three and today it has officially stopped all features except the analog watch Face. I had my Apple 1 series for nearly three years and decided to try something different, at the advice of a friend. I wish I had followed my first mind and invested in another Apple Watch. Now I will but this was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good hybrid watch
customer_reviews.text: Good battery, swipes were a little confusing at first and how to tell if Bluetooth was on and connected. The watch is a little wider than I was expectinf. Fave is easily scratched though, however the band is durable silicone material. I like the traditional style of the face and you can still wear it to tell time if the battery is dead
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Choose a different watch
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Vivomove HR for less than one year and it is constantly disconnecting from Bluetooth and will not reconnect automatically. I have to turn Bluetooth on my phone off, then back on, and scroll through the features menu on my watch and click through a few things to get it to reconnect and then I have to go back to my Garmin Connect App on my phone to sync my information. I have to do this everyday, often multiple times a day. Also, the digital display on the face of the watch is not visible outside during the day. Looks great, but does not work well. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Halsey

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but...
customer_reviews.text: Had difficulties in the final steps of the installation process- unable to find how to mange settings. Taken a lot if trial and error to figure out how to use it best. I’m no where near optimizing functions of this sports watch, though mainly because I lack confidence and skills to manage high tech gizmos well.
customer_reviews.author: indidde

customer_reviews.title: Good looking watch!
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch a lot!! It’s a nice looking watch! I’ve gotten lots of compliments on it! Battery doesn’t seem to last long at all compares to my other Garmin watches. Also not sure if I can use this watch as an activity tracker (other than counting steps). If it can be used for an activity tracker, I haven’t figured it out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Screen failed at 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved the watch up until the screen failed. I used it while walking and swimming and everything was great. It paired easily. Battery life was about 5 to 7 days. I bought a different band and was just pleased with the look as it looked more like a real watch than a fitness tracker. Then poof, one morning, I brought my wrist up to my face to look at the time and it flashed once and then no longer. It still tracks my steps and it does keep time. So now it is just a watch. In the evening or night I can't see the face without a light on the watch. Not happy with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Karski

customer_reviews.title: Great looking watch with basic smart watch capabilities
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch specifically for the emphasis on the analog interface with some smart watch capabilities like notifications and fitness tracking. I like the watch a lot, especially the aesthetics. The smart watch capabilities are pretty basic. You can see who is messaging, but not what the message is; the app integrates all the main fitness statistics. My two main complaints: I don't think the heart rate tracking is terribly accurate, and if you are in full day light, the time can be tough to read. The hour hand is only subtly different from the background and the digital readout isn't quite strong enough to overcome direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: TechFacts

customer_reviews.title: Great for the watch lover who would like some simple smart features.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hybrid smart watch. I love that it looks like a classy, minimalist, regular analog watch but has a hidden display with modern smart conveniences that aren't obtrusive or in-your face. The watch is lightweight, yet balanced well and doesn't feel fragile. The band is extremely comfortable as well.
customer_reviews.author: E. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an anniversary gift and my husband loves it. Easy to use, charge is every 4-5 days. He doesn’t work out much so not sure what effect that would have on the battery life. Looks professional enough to wear every day to work and connecting to his Samsung was easy enough. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: S/M strap is strictly for tiny wrists.
customer_reviews.text: It's very pretty. Unique. My battery lasts 4-5 days until 10%. What I did to like about it was that it came with a S/M band and I'm at the third last hole on the strap. Wanted to buy a longer strap but none are available in the SeaFoam colour...not nice, not even something that would be matching Other than that, it's fine right now almost a month use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D

customer_reviews.title: Best smartwatch I've ever had, and I've had many!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! I used to use wear os watches but I was having problems with Bluetooth connection so I tried this watch. Now Bluetooth is better but no matter how many times I try the wear os, I go back to my garmin every time after less than a day. It's light and comfortable, and looks really pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Bex Bush

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: just got this a week ago and love it! Still trying to figure out how to remove pre-installed apps and how to track sleep. Definitely looks like a regular watch which is what I was looking for. Replaced the silicone band with a mesh one and now it looks even better!
customer_reviews.author: MsAri

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep time
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost I bought a watch. I expect it to tell the time. The heart rate and notification support were nice to haves. It cannot keep time for more than a day or two. Within 24 hours of resetting it's clock the hands are off again. It's useless as a watch. I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: cpoole

customer_reviews.title: Clock face is way off
customer_reviews.text: The clock hands are not even close to correct. This seems to be a problem with almost all of these units. Very annoying. Directions to recalibrate are difficult to follow. I just gave up. Too bad. For the price, and the fact that it is a Garmin product, this seems ridiculous. You shouldn't have to reset the clock every 3 days. If I had kept the box, I would return this in a heartbeat. VERY DISAPOINTED!!! Should be recalled.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan c. tehan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! It is amazingly useful and very cute. I am not a huge fan of the app as it seems to take hours to update. The watch is great though. I find it very accurate and it is eye opening how little I moved before I bought this watch! I have worn it in the ocean and shower and it works great. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Russo

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.  Dont make my mistake, please!
customer_reviews.text: Not versatile in activity selection. T[o much manual entry - if have to do that - I'll use app on my phone. But worst thing, even after several attempts (following exact how Tom's on youtube even) hand never calibrated. Hand moved around constantly. Even while TRYING to check time (which I never could -again, just used phone - why have this watch?)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty but....
customer_reviews.text: The product is super pretty, nice, well made, and for basic smart watch people it would be good for.
customer_reviews.author: Da Fam 2020

customer_reviews.title: Love the Watch
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this watch for a short period of time, but I LOVE it!!! I have been looking to get a smart watch for a while now since my work does a lot of walking wellness challenges I'm always interested in doing. It keeps track of everything I would like it to. The app works amazingly to I think. I love the style of the watch and that it looks very nice and fancy. It looks amazing and dress for while I'm at work and still goes well with casual wear.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as new, but it was clearly worn before
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried the product yet. I am too grossed out. Upon opening the box I discovered that the product appears to have been previously worn (despite being advertised as new). There is skin or something on the back of the band and the box did not have any seals or any of the typical plastic pieces covering the glass and such. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Sallee

customer_reviews.title: would like to return this watch
customer_reviews.text: I could NOT sinc the watch with my phone. I looked in the trouble shooting section, read the directions with no success. Secondly, the hands on the watch would not keep time accurately. When charging, the hands would move one direction then another when unplugged. Lastly, it didn't appear I was successful ever getting it turned on. I would double tap the screen with no success. I therefore believe the watch is simply defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this turd of a watch!
customer_reviews.text: 100% disappointed! This watch and the Garmin app are terrible. The watch won’t stay synced with my phone; it keeps disconnecting with my phone. Now I can no longer sync it and Garmin keeps giving me the same troubleshooting steps over and over and it still doesn’t work and Garmin refuses to refund or exchange this broken turd of a watch. Don’t buy this watch!!!
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoClimber

customer_reviews.title: The quick release watch band can come apart easily when taking a pack on and off or a jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love this tracker. I love keeping track of my steps, sleep, stress levels and calories. The app is great and very user friendly. My only complaint is the quick release band that gets triggered when pulling straps or sleeves over the watch. I have sent mine bouncing across the bus floor and house floor. I haven't had any issues at all with scratching or cracking the glass face but if you're tough on gear like I am, spend the money for the glass protector.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Caused me skin issues, works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch/tracker. However, the band has caused my skin on my wrist to callus and turn red. It looks terrible when I don't wear the watch. It tracks things well and it's very stylish. I get compliments on it all the time. But this skin issue is pretty frustratingand a big turn off. I don't wear it all the time anymore to prevent the skin area from worsening.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Can this tracker be fixed?
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and the style of the watch. I especially like the fact that I can wear in the pool for water aerobics. However today it stoped tracking. Not sure why. I ordered a new charging cord. I am surprised that it didn’t tell me it was going out. I like the fact that it tells time.
customer_reviews.author: jacklyn

customer_reviews.title: Order issue
customer_reviews.text: I placed an order for this, received it and sending it back for another one that is new. The Garmin Watch that was delivered was not new, had dirt and skin particles on the back of the watch from someone wearing it. Also no instructions how to use the watch where included in the packaging, and someone's fitness information was programed. Gross
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Cates

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: So cute and practical! I’m not into fitness, I just needed a stylish time piece that connected to my smartphone and sort of kept track of my activity! I have tiny wrists and the small rose and black watch looks and feels great! FYI, it’s more plastic than I thought it would be, which luckily makes it lighter, yet still making it feel slightly flimsy. The accuracy of everything it tracks is nearly spot on. Technology is not perfect, but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: nice smatwatch
customer_reviews.text: only have it for a week so far I like this watch it looks good and it is easy to use so far it it keeps really good time all the functions work good steps and mileage are almost right on. Would give it a 5 stars if you would not have to get screen protector for it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory G

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a newer smart watch that was also nice looking and this didnt disappoint. Its comfortable and since I got it in black and rose gold goes with everything. It can track not only steps, calories ect but also my workout. Been a great buy, worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Angela Bisher

customer_reviews.title: Band is the fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife and it was an excellent watch. The problem we have is that she lost it due to the band breaking. She did not notice it break and the watch fell off somewhere. I guess we'll move on
customer_reviews.author: Hudnut

customer_reviews.title: My first smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I love that it looks like a timepiece and not a smart watch. Very comfortable to wear, even at night when I track my sleep. I would like more battery life, but again this is my first smart watch and I don't know if this battery life is better or worse than others. It lasts about 3 days for me. It is easy to use besides being beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Highly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Things that cause the step counter to think I'm walking: 1. Sleeping. 2. Using my hand to do anything. 3. Driving 4. Standing completely still In all seriousness, this watch overcounts my steps by thousands.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: touchscreen is impossible to use
customer_reviews.text: Although very attractive, the touchscreen is near impossible to use. Very inconsistent results. It's better to have physical buttons on these devices. It was returned, there are better devices.
customer_reviews.author: yuckypants

customer_reviews.title: This Watch is Super Slick!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for a few months now and I am very happy with it. It is comfortable, stylish, and all of the features seem to work very well. I especially like the "Stress" feature which gives a value based on heart rate variability. It's a quick and convenient way of getting some quantitative insight into the status of your nervous system. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch. Much better than fitbits
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of the watch. The beveled edge keeps it from getting caught on items. Wrist band is fairly comfortable. I work on a ship and watches dont last long but it has survived a few months. Battery for me lasts about 7 days which is much better than a fitbit. The mileage tracking is really close to my gps tracker on my phone. Awesome watch.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: Took a long time to get notifications to work
customer_reviews.text: My wife likes the watch, but the first few hours were very frustrating. It took forever to get the notifications from her phone to work. I spent a few hours adding and removing the app, the device from the software, rebooting, etc. After a while it would work, but only sporadically. Later that night I completed the same steps and it finally worked and still does. She does get quite a few notices on her watch indicating her phone connection has been lost, and then connected, and then lost, etc. But so far it hasn't driven her crazy. Other than those headaches, she likes how the watch looks and performs. And I really like the Garmin connect app.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Getting closer to being a perfect watch but not there yet
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a watch that tracks fitness but doesn’t look loke a fitness tracker. This is perfect except it is still too large for a woman’s wrist (for me anyway). Garmin is my favorite (I tried the Apple Watch and hated the battery life and all the different apps to track everything that garmin tracks in one place (Garmin Connect)). The smart functions are basic, nothing fancy. I think it is overpriced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and works well
customer_reviews.text: Looks great - after a couple of months the hands starting being off by about 10 minutes, and then progressively got slower and is now off by over an hour. The digital time is accurate. I'm not sure if there's a way to reset the hands in the app or something, but there's no dial to manually reset them.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Pulver

customer_reviews.title: Elegant but difficult to read small screen
customer_reviews.text: This watch is elegant and beautiful, however, there is no back lighting to see the time at night. It does have a very small read area that lights up but I need readers to see it and it can’t be seen at all under sunlight conditions. The watch just didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sawyer

customer_reviews.text: Absolutely would recommend. I love how it looks!!! I had a Fitbit Alta for years and this looks so much nicer. More like a fashion watch and less like an activity tracker. I don’t always feel like the sleep tracker is super accurate overall, but my phone also tracks it so between the two it doesn’t bother me. With the new updates to the app, I’m sold! I much prefer the round watch face to the square one of the Fitbit or Apple Watch designs. Like other reviews said, sometimes it gets hard to read the watch menu features in the sunlight, but it’s really not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my Garmin VivoMove HR
customer_reviews.text: I have used Garmin fitness devices since 2014 and I love them and the company stands behind all of their products. I love this Garmin for how attractive it looks and wears and most people don't know it is even a fitness band. I also bought another band that is more like wearing jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J. Ethen

customer_reviews.title: The Best fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I will searching for a hybrid watch that would track my fitness goals. I am so glad I came across a Garmin it is the perfect watch and exactly what I was looking for. Stylish and works great.
customer_reviews.author: DENISE GONZALEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch Got the black and rose gold Water proof No rusting or any discoloring
customer_reviews.author: nOUSHIN HORNBUCKLE

customer_reviews.title: Loved the look but. . .
customer_reviews.text: LOVED the look of this smartwatch, but I found the fitness feature was impossible to read in the sunlight--plus the symbols are very small. I chose to go the Fitbit Versa Lite route (even though not as aesthetically pleasing) because of the ease of use and readability.
customer_reviews.author: dk4659

customer_reviews.title: Pro and con
customer_reviews.text: This watch in this color looked so cute and so good! I love the way it has so many holes to adjust the size to fit, and the screen has a nice big display. The battery life is great! BIGGEST PROBLEM HOWEVER, is the fact that the dial part of the watch didn’t keep up with the digital time. For the first couple of weeks, I had to readjust. Now it’s ok, but I just think that shouldn’t have been a problem since the watch was so new. Other wise I love my garmin watch and how it keeps track of my steps!
customer_reviews.author: Sonja sourivong

customer_reviews.title: A watch that doesn't know the time
customer_reviews.text: The times on the digital and analog don't even match. What's the point? The digital screen is incredibly blurry.
customer_reviews.author: LS

product_meta.title: Garmin vívomove HR, Hybrid Smartwatch for Men and Women, Black/Black, Large
product_meta.description: Style:Sport| Color:Black| Size:LargeFashionably fit is just a tap away with vivo move HR. This stylish hybrid smartwatch features a crystal touchscreen with a discreet display. Precision hands show the time and dynamically move away when you swipe through your messages, heart rate and more. It counts your steps and calories while monitoring wellness, including all-day stress tracking. Memory 7 timed activities; 14 days of activity tracking data.
feature_bullets: Stay connected with smart features such as music controls and smart notifications for incoming calls, text messages, calendar reminders and more (when paired with a compatible smartphone)
Estimates heart rate with Elevate wrist heart rate technology
Wellness monitoring tools, such as all day stress tracking and a relaxation timer, help you manage stress; includes advanced sleep monitoring with REM sleep
Displays steps, calories, distance, heart rate, intensity minutes and VO2 max
Effortlessly change your look with industry standard 20 mm quick release accessory bands
Battery life: up to 5 days in smart mode; up to 2 additional weeks in watch mode (hands tell time only)
Large fits wrists with a circumference of 138 215 mm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,691 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
